newsitem.title: Singapore: Limited Australian refinery turnarounds seen in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Limited Australian refinery turnarounds seen in 1997.

text.p: Refinery turnarounds in Australia during 1997 are being limited so far to secondary units, industry sources said on Wednesday.

So far, British Petroleum Co Plc is the only refiner out of the country's four refiners, with combined production capacity of 787,000 barrels per day (bpd), to have a specific maintenance schedule for 1997.
BP plans to shut a 30,000 bpd residue cracker unit (RCU) at its 130,000 bpd Kwinana refinery in Western Australia for 28 days in the third quarter of 1997, a spokeswoman said on Wednesday.
It plans to shut down a 21,000 bpd RCU for maintenance for five days in July at its 74,000 bpd Brisbane refinery in Queensland.
BP will also close a 13,200 bpd reformer for seven days for regeneration, but the exact timing is yet to be confirmed.

Mobil Oil Australia is planning two turnarounds at its 108,000 bpd Altona refinery in Victoria and its 70,000 bpd Adelaide refinery in South Australia. But plans will only be finalised at the end of the year.
The Shell Company of Australia Ltd said it has no turnaround plans at its 115,000 bpd Geelong refinery near Melbourne in Victoria or at its 80,000 bpd Clyde refinery in Sydney.
Similarly, Ampol Petroleum Pty Ltd has no turnaround plans at its 100,000 bpd Lytton and 115,000-bpd Kurnell refineries.
